collection-1.id: You can write any id you like as long as it is unique in the collection.
collection-1.title: Collection 1 first

collection-1.id: Creating resources trough the REST API will use an uuid v4 by default
collection-1.title: Collection 1 second

collection-2.id: You can have multiple collection in a dataset.
collection-2.title: Collection 2 first

collection-2.id: A collection correspond to a model but is not strongly typed yet
collection-2.title: Collection 2 second

collection-2.id: You can type your collections by updating zod validators in the project
collection-2.title: Collection 2 third

collection-1.id: You can set multiple datasets with any kind of collections you like
collection-1.title: Collection 1 first

collection-2.id: You'll be able to test each dataset separately on your apps
collection-2.title: Collection 2 first

collection-2.id: Two datasets with the same models correspond to different use cases of one app
collection-2.title: Collection 2 second

collection-2.id: Two datasets with different models can be used if you are testing different app or a data driven one
collection-2.title: Collection 2 third
collection-2.something-different: The database supports it as long as you don't prevent it in the zod validator

collection-with-a-name.id: You can indeed rename anything you want in your datasets
collection-with-a-name.title: Example 1

application-settings.description: This is required by the app, do not delete, but feel free to update the values
application-settings.hidden: You can set this property to a non falsy value in any dataset to hide it from the options

active-dataset.description: Which dataset to use in previews and by the REST API
